subject: Re: [junit] req
msgSnippet: Sorry for the copy past error (the method should return void and return nothing) Second try: public void testSave() { AggregatedValidationException result =
messageBody:
Sorry for the copy past error (the method should return void and return
nothing)

Second try:

public void testSave() {
AggregatedValidationException result = null;
try {
assetStore.saveChanges();
} catch (AggregatedValidationExceptionObject e) {
result = e;
} catch (java.lang.Exception e) {
fail("Should have received AggregatedValidationException
received " + e);
}
if (result == null) {
fail("Should have received an exception");
}
return;
}


On Friday, April 20, 2001, at 12:17 PM, Christian van der Leeden wrote:

> My standard way is to have it in the try catch clause. This is a test
> method in a TestCase.
>
> public AggregatedValidationException testSave() {
> AggregatedValidationException result = null;
> try {
> assetStore.saveChanges();
> } catch (AggregatedValidationExceptionObject e) {
> result = e;
> } catch (java.lang.Exception e) {
> fail("Should have received AggregatedValidationException
> received " + e);
> }
> if (result == null) {
> fail("Should have received an exception");
> }
> return result;
> }
>
> Hope that helps
>
> Christian
>
> On Friday, April 20, 2001, at 12:08 PM, <talluri_krishnan@...>
> wrote:
>

>> and pls do let me know the procedure.
>> pls help the needful.
>>
